section.name: History
section.p: Svarog is based on the now defunct "signalml" (uncapitalized, as opposed to SignalML) project, which was begun in 2007 under supervision of Zakład Fizyki Biomedycznej, IFD UW. The development of signalml was being funded with a Polish science grant. A software company, CC Otwarte Systemy Komputerowe Sp. z o.o., was contracted to develop the initial version. The following people were significantly involved in development (or management) led by CC:
(links to the current team list are provided for people who are still involved in the development of Svarog)

In February 2009 the Svarog project was started as an effort led by enthusiasts. The code of signalml, which had been released on terms of the GNU GPLv3 license, was chosen as a starting point. The two projects are formally separate in order to disassociate Svarog from any remaining issues related to the contract between ZFB and CC. As far as we (the Svarog team) know, the signalml project is now effectively dead, unmaintained, unsupported and will not be continued (other than as Svarog).

The old signalml repository (import from CVS) can be viewed here, but using this code for any purpose is highly discouraged (use Svarog instead), and no commit priviledges will be granted to anyone other than the employees of CC.
